lines.text: Well, a new groupie.
28 CT]

[to Sergeant Curtis about Wells]
Get him to explain refinement to you. It's just too divine!

[Contemptuously to Vance]
You know, Vance, there must be some way of getting rid of rat like you. I suppose the best way is just to crunch you underfoot on the sidewalk.
Listen here, you big heel, you've left me flat for over a week!
Well, that's the way i found you!
What were you doing in Philadelpia on Monday?
I never go to Philadelphia!

[Speaking of Jessica]
If there's a remedy for her, it's not in my satchel.
Oh, but, doctor, there must be something... other cases?
The doctors who understood these cases are all dead. They died in the Middle Ages. They would have said she's possessed... and they would have been right... perhaps.

[to Vance]
I'm a housekeeper, not a mouse keeper.
Now let me warn you. If you hurt those mice I shall have the extreme pleasure of knocking you down and kicking your brains out.
Well, that's white of you to tell us, Horace B. Jones.
If I'd known that, I'd never 've acted in your play.
Oh, eh, Daphne, my love, you've never acted in any play and never will.
You try to cheapen everything, both of you. Well, you can't!
[to Damon]
I know about you, you've had a hangover for the last ten years.
[to Daphne]
You, you just hang over with him! You're two cronic grouches.
[Horace exits]
Oh, the poor sap. You didn't mean all those things you said about his play, did ya, honeykins?
If I'd said what I really thought, I'd 've made him cry.
So, you know what my trouble is? I can't fake.
Well, then why are you an actor?
Because all of my life I've wanted to be snake charmer.

[Sticks his pipe in Daphne's mouth]
Here, keep this hot for me until I get back.
How did everything go tonight, Damon?
Oh, the second act was still a choice morsel of limburger.
Say, will you quit jabbering like a theatrical trade journal.
Ben, dear Ben, what a snug harbor you are for a craft that's known some pretty stormy weather.
One day, I was sitting in a barber shop in Oklahoma City, I picked up a paper and there it was, "Jessica Wells Returns To Stage." So, well, we, we came home.
Shut your yap and get outta here!
Why, honey...
Come on, now, fade.
Well, so long.

Allow me to present my brother-in-law, Mr. Stanley Vance. If you want to know about him, ask the warden at San Quentin. There's only one profession that he's shown any skill. He's an expert in the art of living on women. Lovely work, if you can get it. But, of course, it takes a certain slimy charm.
I say, you're getting a little nasty, aren't you?
What till I'm warmed up!
Hello Ben, how's tricks?
Holy jumpin' catfish!
Now, listen Damon, don't be so cocksure of yourself. You're not out of this thing yet, you know. Did you leave any clues?
Not even a false tooth. Baby, they can turn those bloodhounds lose. All they'll ever know is that ol' Massa Tom got down that river.

Well, it's a funny thing. The more brains a murderer has, the more likely he is to pull some bonehead stunt that'll trap him. It's too bad the State doesn't make some exceptions. They hang the death rap on anybody for killing anybody, even a dirty rat like Vance.
Say, will you telephone Aunt Martha and tell her we're going out for the last act. And tell her to put some beer on ice.
